title: [BUG] Crash on SkBitmap(x,y) constructor on Android when upgrading SkiaSharp.Views.Forms from 1.68.3 to 2.80.0
body:
**Description**

Code that worked now crashes when upgrading to SkiaSharp.Views.Forms to 2.80.0

**Code**

  var bitmap = new SKBitmap(114, 108);

**Expected Behavior**

not crash 

Exception Details:
System.DllNotFoundException
  Message=libSkiaSharp.so assembly:<unknown assembly> type:<unknown type> member:(null)

07-10 18:44:08.502 D/Mono    ( 5070): DllImport error loading library 'libSkiaSharp.so': 'dlopen failed: library "libSkiaSharp.so" not found'.
07-10 18:44:08.502 W/Mono    ( 5070): DllImport unable to load library 'libSkiaSharp.so'.
**System.DllNotFoundException:** 'libSkiaSharp.so assembly:<unknown assembly> type:<unknown type> member:(null)'


Upgrading to the latest SkiaSharp.Views.Forms 

- Version with issue:  2.8.0
- Last known good version:  1.68.3
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2019
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- all that apply, remove the platforms that aren't broken or haven't had any testing -->
  - Android: 10.0 
- Target Devices:   <!-- the devices that you noticed this on, e.g. iPhone X -->
  - Surface Duo Emulator
